Reviews.Author: Kent L. Durgan
Reviews.Content: The Steal is fantastic for reading comic books, magazines, and books (of course).  For the price you cannot go wrong.  It is a bit slow when connected to the internet but that is not a deal breaker.  If you are looking for a reasonably priced color tablet, this is it.
Reviews.Title: Great for comics!!!

Reviews.Author: S. Gumbs
Reviews.Content: I received the Ematic eGlide Steal on July 27th.  After fulling charging the device, I began to explore it and encountered:*the screen freezes inexplicably-had to press reset several times.  The screen lock if swiped to the left goes into some type of picture/camera mode but since there are no icons, back arrows, menu or anything, I had no idea what to do. It just got pitch black and tapping the screen got me no results!  Had to get a paperclip and press reset AGAIN!*inadequate touch screen- no calibration to try and fix the problem.  I was able to get online using the wifi, but since the touch screen would click areas I didn't select, it became a very frustrating experience!*the HDMI port wasn't recognized by my HDTV* Using the USB port, the eGlide Steal was not recognized by my computer running on Windows XP.  The USB port does not charge the device*There is no Google Play on the device and Google Play can not be downloaded!  It has to be installed by the manufacturer.*The only way to get apps is to use the Ematic Store- which isn't as easy and user friendly as Google Play and it requires a credit card when registering*it gets very hot when charging.  It comes with this flimsy charger that doesn't fit firmly into the device*the user manual is in a file on the device, but it kept freezing every time I tried to access it! I would've gotten it from the Ematic website, but strangely enough, the eGlide Steal is not one of their listed tablets!  Perhaps it goes by another name?After 6 hours I gave up and will be returning it to J&R; Music
Reviews.Title: Ematic eGlide Steal is definitely stealing your money

Reviews.Author: James Spooner
Reviews.Content: The package looks good and promises a lot. BUT they are a lot like politicians promises - they tell you what you want to hear. So to make things clear- things don't work like they should.  The ematic web sit shows no applications, books, widgets, drivers, etc.  They recommend using soc.io - which wants to process everything through their web page.  A screen tells you that you have to install google play app to access a lot of downloads.  Google play's list of supported devices does not list ematic devices at all.  The music app does not have an off button.  The e-reader will not accept e-books already owned by me.  It is the same with a lot of other apps, plus a number of Officesuite icons with no way to remove them.  Several apps, when removed, do not go away.  Searching forums I am finding a lot of the same complaints, but few solutions that will work without MORE MONEY.  I guess the old adage "You get what you pay for" is still true.
